description: Borrowed from Urdu رَعِیَّت‎ (ra'iyat, “peasant”), from Classical Persian رعیت‎ (ra'iyyat, “peasants; population”), from Arabic رَعِيَّة‎ (raʕiyya, “flock, herd”).

entries.meaning: A peasant or agricultural labourer in South Asia.
examples: In Ireland Paddy makes riots, in Bengal raiyats make paddy; and in this lies the difference between the paddy of green Bengal and Paddy of the Emerald Isle.
